All Classes

Class Description
Animation
Class responsible for performing animations on entity sprites: rolling through a series of images, thus creating the illusion of animation.
Animator
A sprite animator, responsible for animating every entity that has a renderable sprite.
CollisionComponent
The default implementation of a collision component.
CollisionEvent
A collision event created when a colision happens between any 2 entities or the entity and the walls.
CollisionEvent.CollisionType
Represents the type of this collision.
CollisionListener
Listener used to process collision events made when a collision happens.
Component
Base class for any component.
Constraints
Display constraints to a UIHudElement.
Entity
This is the base class for all entities involved in the gameplay, weather it be players or AI.
EntityImpl
Basic implementation of a square entity that is controlled by the player using the WASD keys.
EntityManager
This class serves as a register for all Entities present in the game, renderable or not.
EntitySerializer
Class responsible for serializing entities.
FontManager
Represents a collection of fonts to be used throughout the application.
FontManager.FontType
Enum representing the types of fonts.
GameLauncher
This class is designed to be the entry-point for any game based on the JGame framework.
GameLauncher.UIHudPauseMenuElement
Represents the pause menu that appears when the user pauses the game.
GameSerializer
Class responsible for the serialization of the game in its current state.
GameState
This class represents a game state to be played.
GameStateManager
Class responsible for managing game states and performing initialization and termination of different game states.
GameStateSerializer  
LogFormatter
Formatter subclass responsible for formating log messages generated by the application.
MathUtils
This class provides a set of utility Math methods that can be potentially useful in game logic.
MathUtils.ReduceLambda
Represents an operation that can be applied to 2 numbers.
MovementComponent
The default implementation of a movement component.
MovementComponent.MovementAction
An action to be performed when a specified keybinding is pressed.
ProgramLogger
The main logger for this application.
PropertiesManager
Class responsible for collecting important properties from a file in the file system to be used.
SoundPlayer
The sound player for an application.
SoundPlayer.SoundType
An enum representing the different types of sound that can be played.
SoundPlayerThread
A thread to play a given sound.
SoundStore
A sound bank to store all the audio data used by a game.
Sprite
This class acts as a way of displaying custom entity visuals, supporting animations for said entities.
SpriteSerializer  
Test  
TransformComponent
Data component holding various data about an entity's dimensions and positions, etc...
Tuple
Tuple representation in Java.
UIHud
This class represents a Heads Up Display (HUD) to be rendered on the screen on top of the game after every entity has been updated and rendered.
UIHudBoxElement
Creates a colored square.
UIHudButtonElement
This class represents a "clickable" element rendered on the screen, that could respond to user input.
UIHudButtonElement.ButtonAction
An action to be performed when the button is pressed.
UIHudCheckBoxElement
Class representing a toggable checkbox.
UIHudDropdownElement
Dropdown list of "clickable" buttons to fit inside a reduced space that appears and disappears when the users clicks this element.
UIHudElement
This class represents a base element to be rendered in the HUD.
UIHudInputBoxElement
Class representing an input box, to which the user can write a string of text.
UIHudProgressBarElement
Progress bar that tracks progression of anything that requires so.
UIHudSliderElement
Class responsible for creating a horizontal slider, in order to get a value in a certain range.
UIHudSliderElement.SliderCallback
Functional interface representing a callback to be executed when the value of the slider changes.
UIHudTextElement
This class represents a textual visual element whose only purpose is to display a piece of text to the screen.
Window
The default class for presenting displays on the screen.
WindowUtils
This class provides a set of utility methods for UI/Window related logic, such as figuring the correct display size for visual components.
WindowUtils.WindowParams
Helper class to serve as a data container for screen/window related information.
